label: 赤凰斗士 Fists of the Ruby Phoenix

Abbot Tsujon.name: Abbot Tsujon

Absorb Worldly Influence.description:
Trigger Abbot Tsujon is within the emanation of a magical area effect as it's being created

Requirements Abbot Tsujon is wielding a khakkhara

Effect Abbot Tsujon uses her khakkhara as a medium to absorb the incoming area effect into its central ring. She attempts to counteract the triggering effect. For 1 round after Absorbing Worldly Influence, a glowing orb floats within the khakkhara's central ring, allowing Tsujon to Release Worldly Passions
Absorb Worldly Influence.name: Absorb Worldly Influence

All This Has Happened Before.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Abbot Tsujon is about to roll initiative

Effect Abbot Tsujon experiences a flash of recognition from a previous existence, gaining a +4 circumstance bonus to the triggering roll.

If this causes Abbot Tsujon to be the first creature to act, they also become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round, but they can use the extra action only to Recall Knowledge or Step.
All This Has Happened Before.name: All This Has Happened Before

Release Worldly Passions.description:
Requirements Abbot Tsujon's khakkhara holds a glowing orb from Absorb Worldly Influence

Effect Abbot Tsujon strikes her prayer staff once upon the ground, releasing the energy she captured in it along with the jingling of its rings. She blasts a wave of force in a 30- foot emanation, dealing @Damage[2d6[force]] damage per level of the ability she counteracted (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). If the ability she counteracted usually deals energy damage, she can choose to deal this type of damage instead (for instance, if she used Absorb Worldly Influence to counteract a fireball, she could deal either fire or force damage).
Release Worldly Passions.name: Release Worldly Passions

Stunning Flurry.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Abbot Tsujon makes two Strikes, each of which must be an unarmed Strike or crying temple bell Strike. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses. If either Strike hits and deals damage, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:39|traits:incapacitation] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure); this save has the incapacitation trait.
Stunning Flurry.name: Stunning Flurry

Falling Sal Stance.description: Abbot Tsujon joins their palms together in the shape of a sal flower, evoking the truth that all things eventually decay. In this stance, they can make sal blossom Strikes (see Strikes) and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1}, and can use the extra action only to cast wholeness of body.
Falling Sal Stance.name: Falling Sal Stance

Crying Bell Stance.description: Abbot Tsujon cups one hand and poses the other to strike it, like the Rai Sho Monastery's central bell. In this stance, they can make temple bell Strikes (see Strikes). While in this stance, she gains a +2 status bonus to AC against ranged attacks.
Crying Bell Stance.name: Crying Bell Stance

All This Will Happen Again.name: All This Will Happen Again
All This Will Happen Again.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Abbot Tsujon fails or critically fails a Will save against an emotion effect

Effect Even in the face of overwhelming tribulation, Abbot Tsujon finds solace in the notion that all things are merely part of a never-ending cycle. They reroll the saving throw with a +1 status bonus; they must use the second result.

+1 status to all saves vs. death effects.name: +1 status to all saves vs. death effects

Abbot Tsujon.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. death effects

Blue Viper (Level 20).name: Blue Viper (Level 20)
Blue Viper (Level 20).allSaves: +3 status to all saves vs. transmutation

Infused Items.name: Infused Items
Infused Items.description:
Blue Viper carries the following infused items:

3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.GttLYMT2welSpwCd]{Acid Flask (Major)}

5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.xQS1MSqGQz44FWUh]{Black Lotus Extract}

3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.rpbbfkexLhtadBDV]{Bottled Lightning (Major)}

4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.qK964kZz1ALcysOa]{Elixir of Life (True)}

3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.4DJQID8GIlxQ7b9C]{Frost Vial (Major)}

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.GMi5tw0cbMx3ZQPg]{Mindfog Mist}

3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.5hGJ6CZi0A9OjMd4]{Oblivion Essence}

3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.BxJNWWvpxacDIsdt]{Tanglefoot Bag (Major)}

5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.gDGPvobJV1QGYBPy]{Tears of Death}

2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.IuGydh0En8LbfnWo]{Thunderstone (Major)}

These items last for 24 hours, or until the next time Blue Viper makes his daily preparations.

+3 status to all saves vs. transmutation.name: +3 status to all saves vs. transmutation

Poisoned Coat.name: Poisoned Coat
Poisoned Coat.description:
Trigger A creature adjacent to Blue Viper hits him with a melee unarmed Strike.

Effect The triggering creature is exposed to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6swrLimere2nZtz9]{Dragon Bile}. This consumes the poison, and Blue Viper can't use Poisoned Coat again until he spends 10 minutes applying one dose of contact or injury poison to his clothing.

Pinpoint Poisoner.name: Pinpoint Poisoner
Pinpoint Poisoner.description: When Blue Viper successfully Strikes an off-guard creature with a poisoned weapon or exposes an off-guard creature to an inhaled poison, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to its initial save against that poison.

Plum Rain Deluge.name: Plum Rain Deluge
Plum Rain Deluge.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Blue Viper accelerates the flow of time so his poisons run their course faster. He Interacts to draw a contact poison and throws it in the air, where it showers down in a @Template[burst|distance:20] within 60 feet. All creatures in the burst are automatically exposed to the poison, bypassing any onset time, and each creature must attempt a saving throw against that poison. If a creature fails, the duration of any beneficial spells or effects affecting the creature are reduced by 3 rounds (or by 6 rounds on a critical failure).

Potent Poisoner.name: Potent Poisoner
Potent Poisoner.description: Blue Viper's infused poisons have a DC of 47.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: Blue Viper Interacts to draw a bomb, then Strikes with it.

Toxic Escape.name: Toxic Escape
Toxic Escape.description: Blue Viper Interacts to draw an inhaled poison, deploys the poison in a smoke cloud that provides concealment in a @Template[emanation|distance:5], then Sneaks up to his Speed. He is not exposed to the inhaled poison.

Poison Spray.name: Poison Spray
Poison Spray.description:
Requirements Blue Viper is holding a contact or injury poison.

Effect Blue Viper swigs the poison and sprays it out of his mouth, affecting a @Template[cone|distance:15]. Blue Viper isn't exposed to the poison. All creatures in the cone are immediately exposed to the poison and each creature must attempt a Fortitude save against the poison.

Quick Application.name: Quick Application
Quick Application.description: Blue Viper Interacts to draw an injury poison and applies it to a weapon he is holding.

equipment-Dragon Bile (Applied to body).name: Dragon Bile (Applied to body)
equipment-Dragon Bile (Applied to body).description:
A mix of digestive juices and green dragon poison glands nauseates the victim as its flesh is digested from within.

Activate A Interact (Contact)

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:37]

Onset 1 minute

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[7d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[9d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 4} (1 round)

Bul-Gae.name: Bul-Gae

Shadow Leap.description:
Requirements The bul-gae is in dim light or darkness

Effect The bul-gae dives into a shadow and reappears from a shadow within 40 feet.
Shadow Leap.name: Shadow Leap

Solar Flare.description:
Trigger The bul-gae takes damage

Effect The bul-gae releases a solar flare in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Each creature in the area takes @Damage[6d8[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect] save). On a critical failure, a creature also takes @Damage[2d10[persistent,fire]] damage. After using this ability, the bul-gae's flames cool and they can't use Solar Flare again until after they have used Lunar Burst.
Solar Flare.name: Solar Flare

Lunar Burst.description: The bul-gae releases a blast of otherworldly frost that deals @Damage[6d8[cold]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|options:area-effect] save). On a critical failure, a creature also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}. After using this ability, the bul-gae's flames heat up and they can't use Lunar Burst again until after they have used Solar Flare.
Lunar Burst.name: Lunar Burst

Thermal Mastery.description: The bul-gae has total control over the powers of cold and fire. Each time it attacks with its jaws, it can choose to have the additional damage be either cold damage or fire damage.
Thermal Mastery.name: Thermal Mastery

Eclipse Aura.description: 100 feet. Light and shadows morph strangely around the bul-gae. A creature attempting to create a light effect within the aura must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:5|name:Escape Eclipse Aura] check. On a failure, the attempt fails, the effect is lost, and the DC to counteract darkness effects within the aura is increased by 1.
Eclipse Aura.name: Eclipse Aura

Bul-Gae.publicNotes:
Bul-gaes are manifestations of the eclipsed sun and moon. They resemble large canines, though their coloration and features change as they exercise their powers over heat and cold. Depending on whether they have most recently unleashed their lunar or solar powers, a bul-gae resembles either a crimson hound wreathed in flames or a cerulean, frostbitten fox, respectively.

Legends say that the first bul-gae attempted to steal the sun from the sky. As they bit down on the burning sphere, though, the bul-gae was badly burned. Having failed, they then tried to retrieve the moon, but when they touched the moon the bul-gae froze solid and fell to the ground. The descendants of that bul-gae forever hone their powers of flame and ice so that they may one day succeed where their ancestor failed.

Canopy Elder.name: Canopy Elder

Vine Splint.description: The canopy elder grows a mesh of vines around its broken branches, repairing the damage and restoring @Damage[40[healing]] HP to itself. The canopy elder can't use Vine Splint again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Vine Splint]]{1d4 rounds}.
Vine Splint.name: Vine Splint

Pollen Cloud.description: The canopy elder releases a dense cloud of pollen from the epiphytes living in its branches. The cloud emanates from the canopy elder in a @Template[emanation|distance:40]. The cloud doesn't move with the canopy elder and remains in place for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} before dissipating. Creatures inside the cloud become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the cloud become concealed to creatures within it. Non-plant and non-fungus creatures within the cloud must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}, and on a critical failure the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 minute. Regardless of the result, a creature is then temporarily immune to the sickening and blinding effects of the canopy elder's pollen for 24 hours.
Pollen Cloud.name: Pollen Cloud

Fungal Web.description: The canopy elder launches a rapidly growing net of fungus from the mushrooms growing on its body at a single creature within 80 feet. The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:39] save or become restrained by the fungal web ([[/act escape dc=39]]). While restrained, the creature takes @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage at the end of each of their turns.
Fungal Web.name: Fungal Web

Axe Vulnerability 15.name: Axe Vulnerability 15
Axe Vulnerability 15.description: A canopy elder has a weakness to axes.

Canopy Elder.publicNotes: In the densest and oldest jungles, arboreals can reach heights of 200 feet or more. Given thousands of undisturbed years, these massive creatures enter into a symbiotic relationship with a myriad of plants, fungi, and animals to achieve the esteemed status of canopy elder. They provide a safe home for the creatures they host and develop a variety of powers that help them defend their forest realms.

Cloudsplitter.name: Cloudsplitter

Deflecting Gale.name: Deflecting Gale
Deflecting Gale.description:
Trigger The kirin is targeted with a ranged Strike

Effect The kirin intensifies the wind around themself, gaining a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Peaceful Aura.name: Peaceful Aura
Peaceful Aura.description:
60 feet. Creatures within Cloudsplitter's peaceful aura attempting to use a hostile action must first attempt a @Check[will|dc:39] save; on a failure, the hostile action is disrupted.

If a creature in the aura successfully uses a hostile action, it's temporarily immune to peaceful aura for 24 hours, and while it's temporarily immune, other creatures in the Cloudsplitter's peaceful aura can perform hostile actions toward it without needing to attempt a Will save.

Cloudsplitter can select creatures within their aura that can use hostile actions without needing to attempt a Will save.

Cloudsplitter allows anyone involved in the player character's bout with Jin-Hae to use hostile actions without a Will save.

Susceptible to Death.name: Susceptible to Death
Susceptible to Death.description:
Though phantoms aren't alive, neither are they undead, and they are uniquely vulnerable to the effects of death.

A phantom whose Hit Points are reduced to 0 as a result of a death effect (such as from a spell like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Z9OrRXKgAPv6Hn5l]{Execute}) is immediately whisked away to the River of Souls, where their soul resumes the usual path to the afterlife.

Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
Breath Weapon.description: Cloudsplitter breathes fire in a @Template[cone|distance:30], dealing @Damage[18d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect] save). Cloudsplitter can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

Rearing Thrust.name: Rearing Thrust
Rearing Thrust.description: The Cloudsplitter rushes forward, rears up on their hind legs, and descends upon their target with their horn. Cloudsplitter Strides and makes a horn Strike. If this Strike hits, it deals an additional [[/r 2d8]] damage, and the target is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

-1 status penalty to all saves vs. death.name: -1 status penalty to all saves vs. death effects

Cloudsplitter.allSaves: -1 status penalty to all saves vs. death effects

Riotous Parade.name: Riotous Parade
Riotous Parade.description:
60 feet. The night parade sweeps up those nearby in a riotous celebration. All creatures in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:39|traits:auditory,aura,emotion,enchantment,mental] save. The target is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unafflicted.

Success The target laughs and dances. It can't use reactions as long as it stays in the area, and if it attempts to use a concentrate action, it must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check; on a failure, the action is lost.

Failure As success, except the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} while in the area.

Critical Failure As success, except the target is also slowed 1 while in the area and the flat check DC is 10.

Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
Troop Movement.description: Whenever a troop Strides, it first Forms Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to its Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

Wasshoi! Wasshoi!.name: Wasshoi! Wasshoi!
Wasshoi! Wasshoi!.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The night parade dances with wild abandon, unintentionally striking nearby creatures. It deals damage to each adjacent creature (@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic] save), and any creature that fails its save is pushed 10 feet in any direction as the night parade bounces it overhead. The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(1d10+7)[bludgeoning]] damage

2 @Damage[(4d10+14)[bludgeoning]] damage

3 @Damage[(6d10+14)[bludgeoning]] damage

Seiya! Soiya!.description: The night parade shouts a series of energetic call-and-responses, dealing @Damage[3d10[sonic],4d6[mental]|options:area-damage]{3d10 sonic damage and 4d6 mental damage} to all creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:10] within 20 feet (@Check[will|dc:41|basic|options:area-effect] save). If the troop is reduced to 8 or fewer squares, this area decreases to a @Template[burst|distance:5].
Seiya! Soiya!.name: Seiya! Soiya!

Desecrated Guardian.name: Desecrated Guardian
Desecrated Guardian.publicNotes: Countless temples across Golarion, dedicated to deities both living and forgotten, have risen and fallen through the ages. Many find themselves buried under sand, snow, or vine never to be found. In such places, the spirits of the faithful can bind with their ruined temple to form a guardian construct, though with nothing left to guard, these spirits often become hollow, resentful, and filled with malice. These "desecrated guardians" lie in wait, sometimes for centuries, and destroy any adventurers who happen upon them. The most powerful desecrated guardians, such as the one presented here, incorporate the structures of multiple temples into their massive serpentine forms.

Rebuild.description: The desecrated guardian draws in rubble from the surrounding area to rebuild its damaged body. It recovers @Damage[8d6[healing]] Hit Points. It can only use this ability if it is near suitable rock or rubble.
Rebuild.name: Rebuild

Avalanche.description: The desecrated guardian thrashes its body about, causing the nearby terrain to crumble and crash down on creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:60], dealing @Damage[12d10[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect] save). It can't use Avalanche again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Avalanche]]{1d4 rounds}.
Avalanche.name: Avalanche

Desecration Aura.description: 40 feet. Desecrated guardians exude a palpable malice that nauseates all but the most wicked passersby. Non-evil creatures that enter the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:37] save. On a failure, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). In addition, any non-evil creatures that attempt to Cast a Spell within the aura must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:5] check or the spell is lost.
Desecration Aura.name: Desecration Aura

Coiled Rockslide.description: If the desecrated guardian started its turn hidden, it can Trample and remain hidden until after its attacks.
Coiled Rockslide.name: Coiled Rockslide

Dimensional Darkside Mirror.name: Dimensional Darkside Mirror
Dimensional Darkside Mirror.routine: (1 action) The mirror absorbs another reflected creature into the mirror and replaces it with a mirror duplicate. Mirror duplicates attack on their own initiative, using the same statistics as the original creature, but with an evil alignment (changing only abilities that shift with the alignment change). A mirror duplicate can spend 3 actions in contact with the mirror to return to its original dimension and release the creature it duplicated, but most mirror duplicates prefer not to.
Dimensional Darkside Mirror.reset: The mirror is always ready to absorb creatures into the other dimension. Ten minutes after a creature is sucked into the mirror, if an ally doesn't rescue the creature with Thievery, it reaches the other dimension, where it might be captured or killed. In the mirror dimension, it counts as a mirror duplicate, so the denizens of the other dimension can't destroy the mirror on their side while the absorbed creature is there. These dimensions are alternate realities, not planes, so even rituals like plane shift can't reach them.

Reflection of Evil.name: Reflection of Evil
Reflection of Evil.description:
Trigger A non-evil creature is reflected in the mirror

Effect The mirror absorbs the creature into the mirror, replacing it with an evil mirror duplicate (@Check[reflex|dc:41] to avoid being absorbed into the mirror), and rolls initiative.

Dimensional Darkside Mirror.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:40|name:Retrieve a Creature] (legendary) to retrieve a creature from the other dimension within 10 minutes of the switch (possible only if their mirror duplicate is dead), @Check[thievery|dc:45|name:Disable the Mirror] (master) to permanently disable the mirror once all mirror duplicates are dead, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th rank; counteract DC 37) to counteract the mirror for 1 minute and prevent additional replacements during that time
Dimensional Darkside Mirror.hazarddescription:
A magic mirror replaces characters with evil mirror duplicates from another dimension.

The mirror can't be damaged while any mirror duplicate is alive
Dimensional Darkside Mirror.stealthdetails: (master) to notice it isn't a regular mirror
Dimensional Darkside Mirror.hp: The mirror can't be damaged while any mirror duplicate is alive

Stormflight.description: A kaminari can move in wind with ease. They ignore all difficult terrain from wind and don't need to Maneuver in Flight in high winds.
Stormflight.name: Stormflight

Stormsight.description: Wind, precipitation, and clouds don't impair a kaminari's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from storms, mist, precipitation, and the like.
Stormsight.name: Stormsight

Hurricane Bag.description:
A kaminari's bag holds the four winds. The kaminari unleashes four @Template[burst|distance:20]s within 60 feet with the effects of a 9th-rank wall of wind. In addition, a creature that enters one of the bursts takes @Damage[6d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect] save). The bursts can't overlap. After using this activity the kaminari can't use Hurricane Bag for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Hurricane Bag]]{1d4 rounds}.

If a kaminari creates a column of lighting using Thunder Drums that intersects one of the areas of the wind, the wind explodes in a peal of thunder, dealing @Damage[6d10[sonic]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in the area of that wall of wind burst. Affected creatures must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:40|options:area-effect,damaging-effect] save. The kaminari can detonate only one burst per use of Thunder Drums.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage. Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is deafened permanently.
Hurricane Bag.name: Hurricane Bag

Tempest Tether.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Electricity leaps between two kaminari. The kaminari establishes a connection with another kaminari within 150 feet, and lightning and thunder form a line between the centers of their spaces. For the next minute, a creature that begins its turn in the line or enters the line on its turn takes @Damage[4d12[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:40|basic] save). A creature can take this damage only once per round, even if it moves through several tempest tethers. If the distance between the kaminari ever exceeds 150 feet, the tether breaks.
Tempest Tether.name: Tempest Tether

Thunder Drums.description:
The peal of a kaminari's drums bring thunder and lightning. The kaminari summons four 100-foot-tall columns of lightning to strike in @Template[burst|distance:5]s within 60 feet. These columns can't overlap. Creatures in the burst take @Damage[8d12[electricity]|options:area-damage] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:40|options:area-effect,damaging-effect,inflicts:stunned] save. The kaminari can't use Thunder Drums again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Thunder Drums]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.
Thunder Drums.name: Thunder Drums

Gumiho.name: Gumiho

Guileful Charm.name: Guileful Charm
Guileful Charm.description:
Any creature that converses with a gumiho must attempt a @Check[will|dc:35] save. The creature then becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Critical Success The target is unaffected but knows the gumiho tried to charm it.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is affected by the failure effects of 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm}.

Critical Failure The target is affected by the failure effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate}.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The gumiho changes into humanoid or fox shape. Their humanoid shape has a specific, persistent appearance but their true form is their fox shape. In humanoid shape, the gumiho uses their original size, loses their jaws strike but retains their claws strike, and their Speed is reduced to 25 feet. A gumiho is never able to completely conceal one of their nine tails through this transformation.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Snapping Critical.name: Snapping Critical
Snapping Critical.description:
Trigger The gumiho critically hits with a claw or jaws Strike

Effect The gumiho uses its fox marble to channel the life force lost by the target and heal for half the amount of damage dealt.

equipment-Fox Marble.name: Fox Marble
equipment-Fox Marble.description:
A gumiho wears a strange green amulet around its neck. This fox marble stores all of the gumiho's knowledge. By focusing on the marble, a gumiho can perfectly recall anything it has experienced in its lifetime. A creature who manages to steal a gumiho's fox marble is lucky indeed, for they can also use it to access the gumiho's memories. However, if the gumiho still lives, the vengeful fox will stop at nothing to recover its marble.

Whoever wears a fox marble gains a +2 item bonus to all checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge}.

Gumiho.publicNotes:
Gumihos are legendary nine-tailed fox creatures who, when disguised in humanoid form, use charm and guile to lure prey deep into the forest before revealing their true form and striking. The green-eyed canids use brutally sharp fangs to tear out their victim's throat and feast on their liver. Those few who survive a gumiho's trap recall the canid's eerie green eyes as well as a strange marble amulet warn around the monster's neck.

Old stories claim that a fox transforms into a gumiho once it has lived for a thousand years, quadrupling in size, growing eight additional tails, and gaining the power to change shape. Terrifyingly, it also gains an insatiable hunger for the livers of people. This hunger is so closely connected to a gumiho's power that if it abstains from eating liver for one thousand days, the gumiho loses its magic and permanently takes on its humanoid guise-also losing its evil nature in the process.

Inmyeonjo.name: Inmyeonjo

Blurred Countenance.name: Blurred Countenance
Blurred Countenance.description: Creatures farther than 60 feet from an inmyeonjo see it only as the generic form of a huge bird. An inmyeonjo has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} against attacks originating farther than 60 feet away.

Terrifying Beauty.description:
60 feet. Any creature within 60 feet of an inmyeonjo that the inmyeonjo can see must attempt a @Check[will|dc:32|traits:aura,emotion,fear,mental] save. The effects last for 1 day while it is within the area of blurred countenance.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is immune to the inmyeonjo's Terrifying Beauty for 1 day.

Success The creature finds the inmyeonjo beguiling and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

Failure The creature finds the inmyeonjo terrifying and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature finds the inmyeonjo dreadful, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. They can't willingly move closer to the inmyeonjo.
Terrifying Beauty.name: Terrifying Beauty

Limited Immortality.name: Limited Immortality
Limited Immortality.description: Though an inmyeonjo still needs to eat, drink, and sleep, they don't age and can't die of old age.

Inmyeonjo.publicNotes:
Mountain guides whisper stories of giant white birds that stretch towards the sky, singing with human voices. While these stories are often dismissed as tall tales, the truth is much stranger, for the bird they've encountered not only has a human voice, but one a human face as well. Inmyeonjos are enormous white birds with flowing tails, abnormally long necks, and mask-like human faces. They wear an elongated black headpiece that serves as a vessel for their life energy, enabling their reincarnation through any living creature.

Inmyeonjos often serve as gatekeepers or guardians of the tombs of great sages and leaders who brought peace to their lands and people. They can also be found atop on high mountains where the border between earth and sky is thinnest. Ultimately, inmyeonjos strive for balance and peace among all mortals. A person who has encountered an inmyeonjo often has trouble remembering if the strange creature was beautiful or terrifying.

Waylay.description: When Ji-yook Strides at least 10 feet, illusions make her @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} until the start of her next turn.
Waylay.name: Waylay

Disquieting Change Shape.description: Ji-yook selects one enemy within 60 feet, then Changes Shape into humanoid form, taking the form of a person emotionally close to that enemy, such as a dead family member. Ji-yook is not aware of the form she will take until she transforms. If her target sees her, even if they are aware it is a trick, they must attempt a @Check[will|dc:40] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure) for 1 round. This is a fear effect.
Disquieting Change Shape.name: Disquieting Change Shape

Foxfire Blast.description: Ji-yook makes a fist Strike. On a hit, the target takes an additional 3d6 electricity damage and is pushed back 5 feet. On a critical hit, the target is pushed back and then knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}
Foxfire Blast.name: Foxfire Blast

Pinning Shot.description: Ji-yook pins a foe's clothing to a wall or floor or the ground. Ji-yook makes a dart Strike. If the attack hits, it deals no damage and instead pins the target to an adjacent surface. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and must spend an Interact action to attempt a @Check[athletics|dc:10|name:Pull Dart Free] check to pull the dart free; it can't move from its space until it succeeds. If Ji-yook's dart Strike was a critical hit, the target must succeed at two separate Athletics checks to pull the dart free. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while it remains immobilized in this way.
Pinning Shot.name: Pinning Shot

Sneak Attack.description: Ji-yook's Strikes deal an additional 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack

Toughest Teamwork: Unsettling Murmur.description:
Trigger An enemy within 60 feet is the target of a Strike or attempts a Will save

Effect Just when an enemy is preparing to defend itself, Ji-yook sends an illusion of herself to whisper a disquieting secret or threat into their ear. The enemy takes a -2 circumstance penalty to their AC or Will save against the triggering attack or effect.
Toughest Teamwork: Unsettling Murmur.name: Toughest Teamwork: Unsettling Murmur

Change Shape.description:
Ji-yook transforms into her human form. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. Ji-yook can remain in her human form indefinitely, and she can shift back to her true kitsune form by using this action again.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
Change Shape.name: Change Shape

Emotionsense.name: Emotionsense
Emotionsense.description: Ji-yook can sense the emotions of those within 60 feet as an imprecise sense.

Jin-hae.name: Jin-hae

Susceptible to Death.description:
Though phantoms aren't alive, neither are they undead, and they are uniquely vulnerable to the effects of death.

A phantom whose Hit Points are reduced to 0 as a result of a death effect (such as from a spell like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Z9OrRXKgAPv6Hn5l]{Execute}) is immediately whisked away to the River of Souls, where their soul resumes the usual path to the afterlife.
Susceptible to Death.name: Susceptible to Death

Combined Charge.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Cloudsplitter Strides or Tramples within 5 feet of Jin-Hae

Effect Jin-Hae leaps onto Cloudsplitter's back as he charges. She can make a single melee attack against any target they pass during Cloudsplitter's movement.
Combined Charge.name: Combined Charge

Wind-Fire Charge.description:
Requirements Jin-Hae is wielding her feng huo lun

Effect Jin-Hae blasts off on her feng huo lun, leaving an elemental trail in her wake. She Strides up to twice her Speed and makes a feng huo lun Strike at any point during her movement. The path left by her movement is filled with her choice of an 8th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.it4ZsAi6XgvGcodc]{Wall of Wind} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IarZrgCeaiUqOuRu]{Wall of Fire} spell. Jin-Hae is unaffected by any walls she creates with this ability. She cannot use Wind-Fire Charge again for [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. If she uses Wind-Fire Charge again, the wall created by her previous Wind-Fire Charge disappears as soon as her action is completed.
Wind-Fire Charge.name: Wind-Fire Charge

Wind-Fire Chariot.description:
Requirements Jin-Hae is wielding two feng huo lun

Effect Jin-Hae's feng huo lun float by her feet, giving her the benefits of 7th- level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.U0hL0LLaprcnAyzC]{Migration}. While this lasts, she can wield her feng huo lun even while her hands are full by kicking with them, and her feng huo lun gain the thrown 20 feet trait as well as the effects of a returning rune.
Wind-Fire Chariot.name: Wind-Fire Chariot

Link Swords.description:
Requirements Jin-Hae is wielding two hook swords

Effect Jin-Hae either links her swords together or unlinks them. If the swords are linked, she can make linked hook sword Strikes; if the swords are unlinked, she can make hook sword Strikes.
Link Swords.name: Link Swords

-1 status penalty to all saves vs. death.name: -1 status penalty to all saves vs. death effects

Call a Battle Echo.name: Call a Battle Echo
Call a Battle Echo.description: Effect Jin-Hae pulls one of the battle echoes to her hand. She is fully aware of every echo and can always pull the one she wants, but she cannot call an echo that has already been unsealed.

Jin-hae.allSaves: -1 status penalty to all saves vs. death effects

Master of Barriers.description: Laruhao wishes for nothing more than to dance atop his yagura, undisturbed. When he uses his house of imaginary walls composition spell, he creates four 10-foot-by-10-foot walls in a cube around him. A creature must succeed at a DC 41 counteract check to teleport within these walls; otherwise, the teleportation attempt fails.
Master of Barriers.name: Master of Barriers

Call Dancers.description: Laruhao sends out a pulse of inviting melody that calls more yokai from the ether, restoring @Damage[30[healing]] Hit Points to the dancing night parade.
Call Dancers.name: Call Dancers

Dance, Puppets, Dance!.description: Laruhao plays an invigorating melody that signals his horde to attack. The dancing night parade can use either Seiya! Soiya! or the two-action version of Wasshoi! Wasshoi! as a reaction.
Dance, Puppets, Dance!.name: Dance, Puppets, Dance!

Lophiithu.name: Lophiithu

Beguiling Lure.description: A creature hit by a lophiithu's lure must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:41|traits:illusion,mental,occult,visual] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the lophiithu's lures for 1 minute. On a critical failure, it can't use reactions while it remains fascinated. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 hour.
Beguiling Lure.name: Beguiling Lure

Dimensional Swallow.description: The lophiithu's digestive organs exist in the Maelstrom, regardless of the location of their external form. The lophiithu can swallow any number of creatures of any size. Creatures that Escape the lophiithu's stomach do so normally. Creatures that cut themselves free instead find themselves in the Maelstrom near nothing but one of the lophiithu's disembodied stomachs. When the lophiithu dies, their stomach becomes a rift connecting to their mouth, allowing a creature to return to their plane. This rift disappears after 1 minute.
Dimensional Swallow.name: Dimensional Swallow

Lure Whip.description: The lophiithu makes a lure Strike against each creature within reach. These attacks count toward the lophiithu's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after these attacks.
Lure Whip.name: Lure Whip

Lophiithu.publicNotes: Lophiithus dwell in the deepest ocean trenches, places untouched by light, hope, or mortal comprehension. They appear to be gaping maws with distended jaws, vestigial flaps of putrefying flesh, and filamentous tentacles tipped with glowing light. Their extraplanar mouths take up most of their bodies, leaving no room for other organs, and any prey they swallow is transported to the Maelstrom for digestion.

Orochi.name: Orochi

Multiple Heads.name: Multiple Heads
Multiple Heads.description: A creature can attempt to sever one of the orochi's eight heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's HP. A head not completely severed returns to full HP at the end of the attacking creature's turn. An orochi that loses all of their heads immediately dies.

Orochi Flurry.name: Orochi Flurry
Orochi Flurry.description: The orochi makes a number of jaws Strikes equal to the number of their remaining heads, each against a different target. The orochi's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the orochi makes all of their attacks.

Multiple Opportunities.description: The orochi gains an extra reaction per round for each of their heads that remains beyond the first, which it can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity. They can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, and the orochi must use a different head for each Reactive Strike.
Multiple Opportunities.name: Multiple Opportunities

Head: Weaknesses and Immunities.name: Head: Weaknesses and Immunities
Head: Weaknesses and Immunities.description:
HP 60, multiple heads

Immunities area damage

Weaknesses cold iron 15

Resistances poison 15

Orochi.publicNotes: An orochi is an enormous serpent with eight heads and eight tails that lives among large waterways. Orochi are vile, amoral creatures kept at bay only with yearly sacrifices. Most settlements unable to satisfy an orochi with a sacrifice soon meet their destruction.

Rai Sho Disciple.name: Rai Sho Disciple

Crying Bell Stance.description: The disciple cups one hand and poses the other to strike it, like the Rai Sho Monastery's central bell. In this stance, they can make temple bell Strikes (see Strikes). While in this stance, a disciple gains a +2 status bonus to AC against ranged attacks.
Crying Bell Stance.name: Crying Bell Stance

Falling Sal Stance.description: The disciple joins their palms together in the shape of a sal flower, evoking the truth that all things eventually decay. In this stance, they can make sal blossom Strikes (see Strikes) and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}, and can use the extra action only to cast wholeness of body.
Falling Sal Stance.name: Falling Sal Stance

Nine Seals Spellcasting.description: The Rai Sho disciples have learned a technique that allows them to cast their ki spells more effectively by way of specialized hand postures. They replace the normal somatic and verbal components of their spells with nine seals components; these require that the caster have a hand free, but don't add any traits to the Cast a Spell action (preventing the Rai Sho disciples from triggering certain reactions, such as Reactive Strike, when they Cast a Spell).
Nine Seals Spellcasting.name: Nine Seals Spellcasting

Flurry of Blows.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The Rai Sho disciple makes two Strikes, each of which must be an unarmed Strike or temple bell Strike. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.
Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows

+1 status to all saves vs. mental.name: +1 status to all saves vs. mental

Rai Sho Disciple.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. mental

Rai Sho Postulant.name: Rai Sho Postulant

Snowblind.name: Snowblind
Snowblind.description: When Hiding, the yeti is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by any snowfall, even if it's not thick enough to make other creatures concealed.

Vanish.name: Vanish
Vanish.description:
Trigger The Rai Sho Postulant is hidden or undetected while not in combat, and a creature would observe it.

Effect The Rai Sho Postulant Strides or Climbs up to half its Speed to a location where it can Hide, then Hides. If its new Stealth check result meets or exceeds the triggering creature's Perception DC, the yeti remains hidden.

Frozen Flurry.name: Frozen Flurry
Frozen Flurry.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The Rai Sho Postulant makes two Strikes, which can be any combination of claw or icicle Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses. If either Strike hits and deals damage, the target must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:37|traits:incapacitation] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure); this save has the incapacitation trait.

Grizzly Arrival.name: Grizzly Arrival
Grizzly Arrival.description:
Trigger The Rai Sho Postulant hits a creature in the first round of combat and the Rai Sho Postulant was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from that creature at the start of combat.

Effect Each enemy within 30 feet that witnesses the attack (including the target of the attack) must attempt a @Check[will|dc:37] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}; on a critical failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}.

Nightmare Guardian.name: Nightmare Guardian
Nightmare Guardian.description: Rai Sho Postulants gain a +4 status bonus to saves against fear and against spells and abilities that affect dreams. A Rai Sho Postulant that falls prey to a supernatural nightmare loses this ability and becomes permanently enraged, gaining a +1 status bonus to attack and damage status bonus to attack and damage rolls and a -1 status penalty to AC.

Nine Seals Spellcasting.name: Nine Seals Spellcasting
Nine Seals Spellcasting.description: The Rai Sho postulants have learned a technique that allows them to cast their ki spells more effectively by way of specialized hand postures. They replace the normal somatic and verbal components of their spells with nine seals components; these require that the caster have a hand free, but don't add any traits to the Cast a Spell action (preventing the Rai Sho postulants from triggering certain reactions, such as Reactive Strike, when they Cast a Spell).

+4 status to all saves vs. fear and drea.name: +4 status to all saves vs. fear and dreams

Rai Sho Postulant.allSaves: +4 status to all saves vs. fear and dreams

Ran-to (Level 20).name: Ran-to (Level 20)

Body Slam.name: Body Slam
Body Slam.description:
Requirements Ran-to is grabbing a creature

Effect Ran-to throws his foe against the ground. The grabbed creature takes @Damage[12d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:43|basic] save) and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The creature is no longer grabbed.

Major Leaping Catch.name: Major Leaping Catch
Major Leaping Catch.description: Ran-to leaps from the ground and attempts to grab a foe while he soars. He makes a Leap, High Jump, or Long Jump. His maximum distance is 100 feet. He must succeed at an Athletics check to perform the leap as usual, but regardless of the type of leap the DC is equal to half the number of feet he moves in the air. Ran-to can attempt an Athletics check to Grapple at any point during the jump. Immediately after the attempt, he (and the creature, if the Grapple was successful) falls to the ground. Ran-to takes no falling damage when using this ability, but the grabbed creature takes the appropriate amount of falling damage as if it had fallen the distance moved. Ran-to can spend three actions to use this ability instead of two; if he does, he can use Plummeting Fall to add @Damage[12d6[bludgeoning]] damage to the falling damage dealt to the grabbed creature, and the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Plummeting Fall.name: Plummeting Fall
Plummeting Fall.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements Ran-to has a creature grabbed and the creature is airborne

Effect Ran-to spins and increases the force of gravity, sending him and the creature to the ground. The target takes @Damage[12d6[bludgeoning]] damage from the fall and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}; Ran-to is unharmed.

Whirlwind Toss.name: Whirlwind Toss
Whirlwind Toss.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements Ran-to has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect Ran-to spins the creature he's holding, smashing it against any creatures within his reach, then throws the creature aside. Ran-to attempts an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the grabbed creature's Fortitude DC. Regardless of the result, the creature is no longer grabbed after this activity.

Critical Success Ran-to tosses his foe mightily. The grabbed creature is thrown into a space within 20 feet, takes @Damage[16d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. All creatures adjacent to Ran-to take the same amount of bludgeoning damage (@Check[reflex|dc:43|basic] save).

Success As critical success, except the grabbed creature is thrown into a space within 10 feet, and creatures take @Damage[12d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Failure Ran-to tosses his foe aside. The grabbed creature falls prone.

Critical Failure Ran-to loses hold of his foe.

Titan Wrestler.name: Titan Wrestler
Titan Wrestler.description: Ran-to can attempt to Disarm, Grapple, Shove, or Trip creatures up to two sizes larger than him.

Reactive Strike (Special).description:
When a creature triggers Ran-to's Reactive Strike, he can attempt an Athletics check to Grapple the triggering creature instead of making a melee Strike. He can still disrupt a triggering manipulate action if he critically succeeds his attempt.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]
Reactive Strike (Special).name: Reactive Strike (Special)

+3 status to all saves vs. evocation.name: +3 status to all saves vs. evocation

Attack of Opportunity (Special).description:
When a creature triggers Ran-to's Attack of Opportunity, he can attempt an Athletics check to Grapple the triggering creature instead of making a melee Strike. He can still disrupt a triggering manipulate action if he critically succeeds his attempt.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]
Attack of Opportunity (Special).name: Attack of Opportunity (Special)

Ran-to (Level 20).allSaves: +3 status to all saves vs. evocation

Sanzuwu.name: Sanzuwu

Scorching Gaze.name: Scorching Gaze
Scorching Gaze.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet targets the sanzuwu or one of their allies with a weapon attack

Effect The sanzuwu focuses their gaze on the triggering creature's weapon, heating it to a burning temperature for an instant. The creature takes @Damage[4d8[fire]] damage unless the creature Releases the weapon as a free action.

Fiery Transformation.name: Fiery Transformation
Fiery Transformation.description: The sanzuwu transforms into an enormous bird made of flame. As the sanzuwu begins their transformation, creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:10] take @Damage[6d8[fire]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect] save). While in their flame form, the sanzuwu gains the effects of 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]{Enlarge}. They can use Fiery Transformation again to revert back to their standard form.

Radiant Blast.name: Radiant Blast
Radiant Blast.description: The sanzuwu opens their mouth to produce a bead of burning energy, hurling it a point within 200 feet. The bead detonates, dealing @Damage[7d8[fire],4d10[sonic]|options:area-damage]{7d8 fire damage and 4d10 sonic damage} to all creatures in a @Template[burst|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:blinded] save). Creatures that critically fail become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round. The sanzuwu can't use Radiant Blast again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Radiant Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.

Scorch Earth.name: Scorch Earth
Scorch Earth.description:
Requirements The sanzuwu is standing on the ground

Effect The sanzuwu Strides. A 6th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IarZrgCeaiUqOuRu]{Wall of Fire} appears in all the spaces the sanzuwu left during this movement, lasting for 1 round. The sanzuwu can't use Scorch Earth again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Scorch Earth]]{1d4 rounds}.

Transfixing Sunbeam.name: Transfixing Sunbeam
Transfixing Sunbeam.description:
Requirements The sanzuwu is in their fiery form

Effect The sanzuwu spreads their wings, emitting a bright cascade of light in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the cone must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:33] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Golden Sun.name: Golden Sun
Golden Sun.description: 10 feet. A golden aura envelopes the sanzuwu, protecting them from weak magic. Any non-cold spells of 3rd level or lower burn away and are ineffective. A sanzuwu can deactivate or activate the golden aura as a free action with the concentrate trait.

Sanzuwu.publicNotes: Those who feast on the sun are said to carry its power within them. Sanzuwus are small crows with red plumage and dark throats. According to legend, they stole their burning power from the sun and now fly across the sky as blinding streaks of fire. When they land on the earth, it ignites around them, causing unbound destruction. A handful of people worship these radiant birds and inscribe their three-legged visage on coins, items, and weapons.

Shino Hakusa (Level 20).name: Shino Hakusa (Level 20)

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger Hakusa is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker she can see.

Effect Hakusa gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Pressure Point Attack.name: Pressure Point Attack
Pressure Point Attack.description:
Hakusa rapidly strikes at pressure points to debilitate a foe. She makes a fingers Strike. On a hit, the target takes damage as normal and must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:43] save. Regardless of the result of the save, the target is then temporarily immune to Pressure Point Attack for 1 minute.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's muscles become temporarily weaker. For 1 round, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, and any time it attempts to take an action with the manipulate trait, the action is disrupted unless it succeeds at a flat check with a DC equal to 5 + its enfeebled value.

Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute.

Critical Failure As success, but the duration is 1 minute, the flat check is DC 11, and the target takes a -10-foot status penalty to all Speeds for the duration.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Hakusa's Strikes deal an extra 5d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Ki Absorption.name: Ki Absorption
Ki Absorption.description: Hakusa absorbs vitality with each blow. She gains fast healing 10 for 1 round whenever she successfully Strikes with a melee unarmed attack.

Swallows in Flight.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Hakusa strikes a series of pressure points on her target's body that redirects its ki to the heart, before following up with a palm strike to the sternum. She makes a fingers Strike and a palm Strike, dealing damage as normal. If both hit, the target takes @Damage[8d10[void]] damage as its life energy escapes from its body in a shower of bird-shaped sparks. The target attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:43] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half the void damage.

Failure The target takes full damage, its life energy exploding violently from its back in a @Template[cone|distance:30] originating from the target. All of Hakusa's other enemies in the cone also take the void damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:43|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Critical Failure As failure, but the target takes double void damage.
Swallows in Flight.name: Swallows in Flight

+3 status to all saves vs. necromancy.name: +3 status to all saves vs. necromancy

equipment-Potion of Quickness.name: Potion of Quickness
equipment-Potion of Quickness.description:
Activate A (manipulate)

Drinking this silver potion grants you the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Haste} for 1 minute.

Shino Hakusa (Level 20).allSaves: +3 status to all saves vs. necromancy

Spatial Sense.name: Spatial Sense
Spatial Sense.description: Syndara instinctively knows the position of all creatures and objects within the Glass Lighthouse as a precise sense. His senses do not extend into extraplanar spaces (such as a bag of holding), even if the entrance to these spaces is within the Lighthouse.

Keeper of the Lighthouse.name: Keeper of the Lighthouse
Keeper of the Lighthouse.description: Syndara can choose whether he is affected by his worldspheres.

Portal Redirection.name: Portal Redirection
Portal Redirection.description:
Trigger Syndara is targeted by a ranged Strike or spell attack roll

Effect Syndara opens a portal in front of the incoming missile, then opens another portal nearby that fires the missile at another creature within 60 feet of him. He takes no damage from the triggering attack and makes a ranged Strike with a +43 attack bonus. The Strike deals damage according to the triggering ability.

Extradimensional Immunity.name: Extradimensional Immunity
Extradimensional Immunity.description: Syndara can foil any attempts to use planar powers against him. He is immune to all extradimensional effects, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}, but can choose to be affected by such effects normally.

Mover of Worlds.name: Mover of Worlds
Mover of Worlds.description: With great regret, Syndara calls his masterpieces from the firmament to crash down upon his enemies. He flings four worldspheres to any four points within 500 feet. Each worldsphere deals @Damage[20d6[untyped]] damage in a @Template[burst|distance:40] (@Check[reflex|dc:48|basic] save). Syndara chooses the type of damage for each worldsphere, which can be any type he chooses, though each worldsphere must deal a different type of damage. On a failed save, the target is pushed to the edge of the burst. No matter how many overlapping explosions it's caught in, a creature can take damage from only one worldsphere per round. Syndara is immune to the damage dealt by his worldspheres. Syndara can't use Mover of Worlds again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Mover of Worlds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Dimensional Flurry.name: Dimensional Flurry
Dimensional Flurry.description: Syndara makes six Strikes. Any creature struck must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:46|name:Dimentional Flurry|traits:conjuration,divine,teleportation] save or be teleported to a location of Syndara's choice within 60 feet of him when the flurry is complete. The teleportation has the conjuration, divine, and teleportation traits.

+1 status to all saves vs. magical.name: +1 status to all saves vs. magical

Dimensional Grasp.description: Syndara's grasp extends across dimensions. Creatures grabbed by Syndara can't benefit from teleportation, extradimensional effects, or effects that would move them to a different plane.
Dimensional Grasp.name: Dimensional Grasp

Center of the World.name: Center of the World
Center of the World.description:
Trigger A creature finishes moving, even if it moved using something other than a move action

Effect Syndara is the figurative and literal center of this world. As the triggering creature moves, space reasserts itself, teleporting Syndara to be in the same position relative to the creature as he was when the creature began its movement. If the space he would teleport into is occupied, he displaces the obstructing creature or object into the nearest available space.

+4 status to all saves vs. mental.name: +4 status to all saves vs. mental

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Spirit Turtle.name: Spirit Turtle
Spirit Turtle.publicNotes:
Spirit turtles are benevolent fey known to heal those in need and confer other powerful gifts. These gentle giants resemble enormous turtles and often bear entire ecosystems on their shells.

In ancient times, so the legend goes, spirit turtles used to grant wishes to many mortals. After millennia of such encounters, the giant creatures grew tired and went into hiding or returned to their home plane, the First World. Those few spirit turtles who remain on Golarion now grant their favors only to the purest and worthiest mortal petitioners.

Pacifying Aura.description: 100 feet. A spirit turtle exudes a constant feeling of calm. Creatures within the aura are subjected to a 10th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} spell (@Check[will|dc:44] save). The effects persist up to 1 hour, even if the creature leaves the aura. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 hour.
Pacifying Aura.name: Pacifying Aura

Unbalancing Stomp.description: The spirit turtle makes a foot Strike. Whether or not the Strike hits, the stomp creates a shockwave on the ground in a @Template[burst|distance:15] centered on the target. All creatures in the area other than the spirit turtle take @Damage[10d10[bludgeoning],4d8[untyped]|options:area-damage]{10d10 bludgeoning damage and 4d8 energy damage} and are knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} (@Check[reflex|dc:41|basic|options:area-effect,inflicts:prone] save). Creatures that critically succeed at their Reflex save are not knocked prone. The spirit turtle can't use Unbalancing Stomp again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Unbalancing Stomp]]{1d4 rounds}.
Unbalancing Stomp.name: Unbalancing Stomp

Environmental Balance.description:
Trigger The spirit turtle begins their turn

Effect The spirit turtle harnesses their connection with the world around them to augment their attacks. They choose acid, cold, electricity, or fire. The energy damage dealt by their Strikes and Unbalancing Stomp changes to the selected energy type.
Environmental Balance.name: Environmental Balance

Regeneration 25 (Deactivated by Cold Iro.name: Regeneration 25 (Deactivated by Cold Iron or Unholy)

Spirit Turtle.hp: regeneration 25 (deactivated by cold iron or unholy)

Sthira.name: Sthira
Sthira.publicNotes:
The Wall of Heaven claims many intrepid climbers. Some such travelers come seeking fortune. Others seek enlightenment. Many, however, find only an icy death. With no means for a proper burial, many of these unfortunate souls remain abandoned to the ice, their bodies becoming macabre guideposts along mountain trails.

Through means unknown, the most willful of these frozen travelers reanimate to seek vengeance upon the living for their denied burial. Such creatures, called sthiras, are composed of multiple bodies or body parts frozen together into one horrific monstrosity.

Create Sthira.description: When a creature dies while it has persistent cold damage from the sthira's frostbite, the creature rises as a sthira in 24 hours. If the creature is grappled by the sthira when it dies, the dying creature becomes permanently fused with the sthira instead. In this case, the sthira immediately recovers a number of Hit Points equal to the half the dead creature's maximum Hit Points.
Create Sthira.name: Create Sthira

Freezing Death.description: 20 feet. A creature that starts its turn in the aura takes @Damage[6d6[cold]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save). If the creature is grabbed or restrained by the sthira, it takes one degree of success worse than it rolled.
Freezing Death.name: Freezing Death

Frozen to the Touch.name: Frozen to the Touch
Frozen to the Touch.description: A creature that damages the sthira with an unarmed attack, tries to Grapple it, or otherwise touches it takes @Damage[6d6[cold]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save).

Frostbite.description:
A creature that takes cold damage from a sthira's Strikes or aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save. A creature that already has persistent cold damage from frostbite ignores this effect.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected, and is temporarily immune to this ability for 1 hour.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[3d6[persistent,cold]] damage.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.
Frostbite.name: Frostbite

Syu Tak-nwa (Level 20).name: Syu Tak-nwa (Level 20)

Dragline Trip.description:
Trigger A creature within 20 feet uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Effect Syu Tak-nwa surreptitiously sends a strand of hair through a portal to emerge near the creature's feet, wings, or other ambulatory limbs. She attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} the creature.
Dragline Trip.name: Dragline Trip

Silkworm's Basket.description: Syu Tak-nwa tears thousands of minute portals into space, sending a single hair through each. The hairs emerge at a space within 30 feet, braiding and twining together to create a cube 20 feet to each side. This has the effects of a 10th-rank force cage, except that Syu Tak-nwa does not need to sustain the basket; it has a duration of 1 minute. While the Silkworm's Basket persists, Syu Tak-nwa is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} and can use the extra action only to make a hair or braid Strike against any target within the basket, regardless of her distance to them. She can't create more than one basket at a time.
Silkworm's Basket.name: Silkworm's Basket

Spiraling Web.description:
Trigger Syu Tak-nwa is the target of a ranged Strike or ranged spell attack roll

Requirements Syu Tak-nwa is aware of the attack and not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against it

Effect Hairs erupt from portals around the missile and attempt to wrap around it. Syu Tak-nwa gains a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If this would cause the attack to miss, the missile remains tangled and suspended in midair.
Spiraling Web.name: Spiraling Web

Empowered Hair.description: Tak-nwa's mastery over her prehensile hair while in the Glass Lighthouse is so powerful that she can walk on thick strands like giant spider legs. This makes her immune to tripping, and she ignores the effects of difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain). She can use her living hair to perform precise tasks such as picking up objects and performing simple Interact actions. She can also deliver hexes through her hair. Whenever Tak-nwa successfully casts a hex focus spell that requires 2 or more actions to cast and that doesn't require a spell attack roll, if her target is within reach, as part of the spellcasting activity she can make a hair Strike against the foe before applying any effects of the hex. If this Strike misses, the hex has no effect.
Empowered Hair.name: Empowered Hair

Familiar.description: Tak-nwa's familiar is an elephant hawk moth named Yon-so. Yon-so has a fly Speed of 40 feet, darkvision, and scent as an imprecise sense to a range of 30 feet. Yon-so can speak Tien, and when Yon-so rolls a success on a Reflex or Fortitude save it takes no damage against the effect.
Familiar.name: Familiar

+3 status to all saves vs. conjuration.name: +3 status to all saves vs. conjuration

Syu Tak-nwa (Level 20).allSaves: +3 status to all saves vs. conjuration

Takatorra (Daitengu Form).name: Takatorra (Daitengu Form)

Toughest Teamwork: Wind Shell.name: Toughest Teamwork: Wind Shell
Toughest Teamwork: Wind Shell.description:
Trigger An ally within 60 feet is targeted by a physical ranged attack

Effect Takatorra wraps their ally in a protective shell of air. The ally gains a +4 status bonus to AC against physical ranged attacks until the beginning of their next turn.

Airflow Blades.name: Airflow Blades
Airflow Blades.description: Takatorra extends the cutting surface of their blades with high-pressure airflow. Until the end of their turn, their blades have a reach of 15 feet.

Disarming Whirl.name: Disarming Whirl
Disarming Whirl.description: Takatorra spins, striking at their foes' weapons. Takatorra attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} against each enemy within their melee reach. Each attempt counts toward Takatorra's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until they have made all the attempts.

+2 status to all saves vs. air and elect.name: +2 status to all saves vs. air and electricity

Blade Barrage.description:
Takatorra unleashes a flurry of attacks. Takatorra makes five melee Strikes. They gain a cumulative +2 circumstance bonus to damage for each successful Strike. If one target is hit with at least two of these Strikes, they also take @Damage[2d6[bleed]]. They then become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of their next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.aMQxiTCdTxVcradv]{Effect: Blade Barrage}
Blade Barrage.name: Blade Barrage

Takatorra (Daitengu Form).allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. air and electricity

Tino (Oni Form).name: Tino (Oni Form)

Toughest Teamwork: Catapult Ally.name: Toughest Teamwork: Catapult Ally
Toughest Teamwork: Catapult Ally.description:
Trigger An ally using a move action moves within reach of Tino's kanabo

Effect Tino scoops his ally with his kanabo and flings them 30 feet in any direction. They can continue any remainder of their movement from their landing location

Earth-Shattering Strike.description:
Requirements Tino's previous action was to successfully Strike an enemy with a weapon that dealt bludgeoning damage

Effect A shockwave blasts out from the force of Tino's strike. Tino attempts a single Athletics check again the Fortitude DC of all enemies within 15 feet. Regardless of the result of the check, all terrain within the area becomes difficult terrain as the ground is cracked into loose shards.

Critical Success Tino pushes the creature 10 feet, knocks it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and deals @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage to it.

Success Tino pushes the creature 10 feet and knocks it prone.

Failure Tino pushes the creature 10 feet.
Earth-Shattering Strike.name: Earth-Shattering Strike

A Kanabo to an Oni.name: A Kanabo to an Oni
A Kanabo to an Oni.description: Tino loses himself further to the oni, pulling out even more strength. He makes a kanabo Strike that deals two additional weapon dice of damage.

Wall of Iron.description: Tino raises his kanabo defensively, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC.
Wall of Iron.name: Wall of Iron

Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
Flurry of Blows.description: Tino makes two Strikes with his fist or with a monk weapon. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

Stalwart Guardian.name: Stalwart Guardian
Stalwart Guardian.description: Tino gains a reaction at the start of each enemy's turn that he can use only during that enemy's turn.

Tino (Oni Form).blurb: Dimensional superposition form of Tino Tung

Yabin (White Serpent Form).name: Yabin (White Serpent Form)

Poisonous Floodwaters.name: Poisonous Floodwaters
Poisonous Floodwaters.description: 10 feet. Yabin is surrounded by magically generated waist-deep poisonous waters. Enemies that enter the water are exposed to his white serpent venom. The aura is difficult terrain for creatures without a swim Speed. Every time Yabin Casts a Spell, the aura increases in radius by 5 feet, up to a maximum of 60 feet. He can activate or suppress this aura as a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

Rattling Magic.name: Rattling Magic
Rattling Magic.description: Yabin substitutes all spellcasting components when Casting a Spell with rattling of his tail. This has the concentrate trait.

White Serpent Venom.name: White Serpent Venom
White Serpent Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:36]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} (1 round)

Toughest Teamwork: Envenomed Strike.description:
Trigger An ally within 20 feet makes a Strike that would deal piercing or slashing damage and hasn't yet rolled the attack roll

Effect Yabin spits venom on his ally's weapon. The Strike, if it hits, also exposes the target to Yabin's white serpent venom. If the Strike misses, the venom evaporates off immediately.
Toughest Teamwork: Envenomed Strike.name: Toughest Teamwork: Envenomed Strike

Yabin (White Serpent Form).blurb: Dimensional superposition form of Yabin the Just

Deadly Disarm.name: 致命卸武 Deadly Disarm
Deadly Disarm.description: 灵巧战士成功的[[/act disarm]]检定会对目标额外造成@Damage[(2d6[precision])[untyped]]伤害。

Tumbling Attack.name: 翻滚攻击 Tumbling Attack
Tumbling Attack.description: 灵巧战士行走一次。在移动中，他可以穿越一个生物占据空间且不触发反应动作。当他以此法穿越生物占据空间时，该生物直到灵巧战士回合结束前@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}。若灵巧战士移动结束时近战触及内至少有一个敌人，他可以对触及内的生物发动一次近战打击。

Nimble Dodge.name: 灵巧躲避 Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
触发 灵巧战士被自己看得见的攻击者进行一次近战或远程攻击

效果 灵巧战士对抗触发攻击的AC获得+2环境加值。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 灵巧战士的打击对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}的生物造成额外2d6精准伤害。

Agile Warrior (Nightmares).name: 灵巧战士 Agile Warrior (噩梦队)

Deadly Disarm.name: 致命卸武 Deadly Disarm
Deadly Disarm.description: 灵巧战士成功的[[/act disarm]]检定会对目标额外造成@Damage[(2d6[precision])[untyped]]伤害。

Tumbling Attack.name: 翻滚攻击 Tumbling Attack
Tumbling Attack.description: 灵巧战士行走一次。在移动中，他可以穿越一个生物占据空间且不触发反应动作。当他以此法穿越生物占据空间时，该生物直到灵巧战士回合结束前@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}。若灵巧战士移动结束时近战触及内至少有一个敌人，他可以对触及内的生物发动一次近战打击。

Nimble Dodge.name: 灵巧躲避 Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
触发 灵巧战士被自己看得见的攻击者进行一次近战或远程攻击

效果 灵巧战士对抗触发攻击的AC获得+2环境加值。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 灵巧战士的打击对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}的生物造成额外2d6精准伤害。

Air Rift.name: 气流裂隙 Air Rift
Air Rift.stealthdetails: (大师) 注意到剧场中突然发生的意外
Air Rift.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:38|name:Air Rift Arcana|traits:hazard,environmental,magical,air]（大师）用魔法将裂隙缝合；@Check[nature|dc:40|name:Air Rift Nature|traits:hazard,environmental,magical,air]或@Check[survival|dc:40|name:Air Rift Survival|traits:hazard,environmental,magical,air]（传奇）打开足够多的门窗，降低狂风的烈度；或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]（反制等级7环级；反制DC34）反制气流裂隙。
Air Rift.hazarddescription: 舞台上撕开了一个通往气元素位面的入口，导致咆哮的风撕裂整个剧院。
Air Rift.routine:
（1 动作）风在该区域内以随机方向吹动，气流裂隙导致50尺内的生物和物品向上、下、北、南、东或西方向被吹走（投掷d6来决定具体方向）。该区域内的生物和物体必须尝试@Check[fortitude|dc:37|traits:damaging-effect,air,environmental,magical,hazard]豁免。如果一个生物撞上了另一个同样受此效果影响的物品或生物，则双方都会因为冲击而受到@Damage[(3d8+15)[bludgeoning]]伤害。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物被推离10尺，但是仅受到一半的冲击伤害。

失败 生物被推离20尺，被击倒地，受到全额冲击伤害。

大失败 生物被推离40尺，被击倒，受到双倍冲击伤害。

AC 40 vs. Reactions and Ranged Weapon At.name: 对抗反应动作和远程武器攻击为40

Earth Vulnerability.name: 岩土易伤 Earth Vulnerability
Earth Vulnerability.description: 气元素位面是土元素位面的对立面。任何带有土特征的法术或魔法效果，在瞄准裂隙50尺内的目标或区域时，每个法术环级（魔法物品、专长等每2个等级）都能对裂隙造成10点伤害。例如，对裂隙附近的生物施放3环@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{地缚术 Earthbind}能对裂隙造成30点伤害。

Weightlessness.name: 失重 Weightlessness
Weightlessness.description:
触发 一个生物进入裂隙50尺范围内

效果 气流裂隙在生物周围制造一个个体化的反重力场，持续1分钟。该生物能通过一个带有专注特征的自由动作，选择让重力将它们拉向任意方向。该生物可以沿着任何表面行走，或者选择一个方向在空中直线飞行。对于无主物品和无心智生物来说，这是微重力环境：它们会在原地漂浮，除非被推离表面。

Akila Stormheel.name: 阿基拉·暴风踵 Akila Stormheel
Akila Stormheel.blurb: 女性半身人翠绿玉枝助研生

Agile Faller.name: 轻身落 Agile Faller
Agile Faller.description: 阿基拉受到的坠落伤害减半。

Change Shape.name: 变身 Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
阿基拉的面具和她的脸融合在了一起，她变成一只花豹，或变回半身人形态。在花豹形态下她只能使用啃咬打击（造成@Damage[(3d6+10)[piercing]]伤害，外加擒获）或带有灵巧特征的爪抓打击（造成@Damage[(3d4+10)[slashing]]伤害）

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Pounce.name: 猛扑 Pounce
Pounce.description: 阿基拉行走，然后打击。如果她此动作开始时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{藏匿 Hidden}状态，则她在打击完成后依然保持藏匿。

Powerful Leap.name: 强力跳 Powerful Leap
Powerful Leap.description: 阿基拉跳跃最多50尺远10尺高，或最多25尺高10尺远。她能在跳跃途中的任意一点进行一次打击。如果她命中，她附带的冲击力会造成额外@Damage[8[bludgeoning]]伤害。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 阿基拉的打击对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}的目标造成额外1d6精准伤害。

Quick Draw.name: 及时备战 Quick Draw
Quick Draw.description: 战舞者以交互动作拔出武器，然后用它进行一次打击。

Shield Drum.name: 击打盾牌 Shield Drum
Shield Drum.description: 战舞者举盾，然后对敌人@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{挫败士气 Demoralizes}。

Threatening Dance.name: 威胁之舞 Threatening Dance
Threatening Dance.description:
战舞者选择先快步后@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.EEDElIyin4z60PXx]{演出 Performs}，或者先表演后快步。将表演检定结果和战舞者触及内一个生物的意志DC 相比较。

大成功 生物对所有攻击@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}，直到战舞者的下个回合开始。

成功 生物对战舞者之外的生物做出的下一次攻击措手不及，直到战舞者下回合开始。

Angoyang.name: 旺宅猫 Angoyang
Angoyang.senses: 皮屑感官（1英里、模糊），黑暗视觉
Angoyang.publicNotes:
旺宅猫外观上就像个长有老虎黑纹的白花猫。它们有漂亮的丝质皮毛，锐利的蓝眼睛和长长的毛茸尾巴。然而，这看上去如画一般的猫咪伴侣实际上和外观大相径庭，旺宅猫是一种骇人的生物，其能剥开脸上的肉质层，露出大量长而带齿的触须。

尽管大部分猫都会躲开旺宅猫出没的地区，那些不幸碰见它们的猫会被带齿的触须缠住并吃掉。在旺宅猫居住的城镇里，养猫的人可能会发现他们心爱的宠物失踪了，但很快却会有一只毛茸茸的黑白花猫碰巧出现在他们的门口，睁着大眼睛看着他们，可爱地喵喵叫。旺宅猫几乎从不攻击它们的看护人，它们把看护人看作给自己喂食、清洁身体、并宠爱它们的忠实仆人，这些生物也因此会保护它们家里的人不受任何潜在的入侵者所伤。然而，一位忽视或者虐待旺宅猫的看护人往往会遭遇可怕的命运。不止一名验尸官或掘墓人在被指派清理前“主人”支离破碎的遗体后，无意中继承了一只旺宅猫。

Dander Scent (Imprecise) 1 mile.name: 皮屑感官（1英里，模糊）
Dander Scent (Imprecise) 1 mile.description: 旺宅猫能模糊地感知到1英里内任何曾经接触过它皮毛的生物的位置。

I Am A Cat.name: 我是只猫 I Am A Cat
I Am A Cat.description: 旺宅猫在伪装成一只猫的时候欺骗检定值和DC自动取47。

Silent Yowl.name: 寂静怒号 Silent Yowl
Silent Yowl.description:
旺宅猫张开它的嘴，卸下天真的伪装，释放出可怕的触须，并发出一声令人毛骨悚然的尖叫，以一个它能看到的生物为目标，造成@Damage[8d10[mental]]伤害。只有目标才能听到这声尖叫。目标必须成功通过@Check[will|dc:30|traits:damaging-effect]豁免，因为吼声撕裂了他们的心智。

大成功 目标不受伤害并在24小时内免疫此能力。

成功 目标受到一半伤害。

失败 目标受到全部伤害并获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

大失败 目标受到双倍伤害并获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}。

Slow Blink.name: 缓慢眨眼 Slow Blink
Slow Blink.description: 旺宅猫轻轻地喵一声，慢慢地对着一个生物眨两次眼。目标必须进行@Check[will|dc:31]豁免。大成功时目标不受影响并在24小时内免疫此能力。否则，这只动物就会被抚摸旺宅猫丝绸般皮毛的冲动所征服，被它@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{迷魂 Fascinated}。如果旺宅猫攻击该生物，该生物可以在下回合开始时尝试一次新的豁免。

Anugobu Apprentice.name: 阿努学徒 Anugobu Apprentice
Anugobu Apprentice.publicNotes:
在彤嘎民间被视为神授的艺术家和工匠之才而颇具声誉，原居于民那塔岛心， 阿努人是一群满心好奇的小型人型生物。在数不尽的故事中，描述了阿努人潜藏在民那塔城市周边，修理并强化其他人型生物的构造物和建筑的事迹。因为他们小巧且瘦弱的体型，阿努人据说在面对较大的人和生物时都极其害羞。在让所有人走出室内一同欢聚的节日， 民间传说中阿努人总会无一例外的躲在黑暗中或者只是觉得未被别人察觉的地方，偷偷进行着精巧创造和修复物件之事。许多有名的彤嘎民间故事中，总有类似于被自然灾害破坏的房屋在第二天早上奇迹般复原，或者未完成的建筑工程，例如修到一半的桥梁神秘完成让工人好奇是谁修建的内容。

根据大多数传说，阿努人是无可匹敌的建筑与工程学大师，并且运用这种专长修建了繁复的建筑或者极大幅度强化了已有建筑。有些人对这些超乎寻常的故事抱有怀疑，但是任何见证过一名阿努人在建筑墙壁上和屋檐下往返走动的人都大开眼界从而相信这些传说绝非胡编滥造。事实上，虽然阿努人全都拥有着锻造和建造的内在天赋，并且可以在墙壁和屋檐行走，但他们和任何类人物种一样个体千差万别。阿努人有着和辛族人相似的外表，但个头极其小。大多数阿努人身高不超过2尺并且体重不超过30磅——迷你的体型让他们可以穿越缝隙，并且不被高个人种注意到。几乎所有可验证的与阿努人遭遇都发生在民那塔岛上。

在大多数阿努人文化中，每个阿努人都在寻求一生的终极目标，他们将其称为他们的巡游。巡游指的是任何一项无人从事并让阿努人欣喜若狂的具体事项。任何事项都可成为阿努人的巡游，从修复宏伟教堂到前往神秘洞穴狩猎具体的野兽。当一名阿努人找到了自身的巡游，他们都会陷入肃然起敬的出神之中并将自己全身心投入完成工作中，有时一次事项会持续花费数日或数周时光。当一名阿努人完成他们巡游最后的细枝末节后，他们的一生辛劳即圆满了，然后他们会用余生来协助其他阿努人的巡游或者招收学徒以传授自己的技能。

大多数年轻阿努人都会参与于不止一项的学徒训练以图在他们所选行业中习得先进的技术。此处描述的学徒专精于建造和工程学，其实阿努人也一样喜欢从事烹饪、狩猎、裁剪或任何会引起他们兴趣的真实事物。

Planar Workshop.name: 工坊位面 Planar Workshop
